title: Police find body behind Lidl store in hunt for 30-year-old woman
text:
Ms Harker (pictured) vanished yesterday morning and a body has been found today

Police searching for a missing 30-year-old woman have found a body behind a Lidl supermarket and arrested a man on suspicion of murder.

The body was discovered behind the branch at Brough with St Giles, Colburn, near Catterick Garrison, in North Yorkshire on Wednesday evening.

North Yorkshire Police had appealed for information about Natalie Harker after she went missing from her Colburn home earlier that day.

A 44-year-old man has been arrested and extensive enquiries are being conducted in the area, police have said.

Yesterday, police put out an appeal to try and find Ms Harker after she went missing.

It read: 'Natalie was last seen on CCTV on Richmond Road, Catterick Garrison, just before 8am this morning.

'She was wearing a pink fluorescent raincoat and dark waterproof leggings and riding her blue coloured bicycle.'
description: Natalie Harker (pictured) vanished after leaving her Colburn home in North Yorkshire yesterday riding her bicycle and police have now found a body.
